subject: Football
Executives and Management
lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said owners could vote in May on plans to lengthen the regular season to 17 or 18 games, though the longer season is unlikely to begin before 2011.
snippet: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said owners could vote in May on plans to lengthen the regular season to 17 or 18 games, though the longer season is unlikely to begin before 2011.
